definition-item.definition-title: HARVESTING; MOWING

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Methods, apparatus or hand tools for
Separation of useful parts of plants (e.g. seeds, fruits, roots, stalks or leaves) from the remainder of the plants in the place where the plants are grown;
Mowing of plants (e.g. grass or cereals), regardless of whether the intention is to make use of the mown plants or not;
Gathering of whole plants (e.g. root crops or onions) or their useful parts (e.g. fallen fruit) from where the plants grow or from the ground;
Haymaking, i.e. working on mown forage crop lying on the ground with the intention to make hay.
Hand rakes.
Forks
Non-abrasive sharpening devices for scythes, sickles or the like.
Containers for whetstones for use during harvesting.
Machines specially adapted for binding of harvested hay, straw or similar crops in the field.
Arrangements for making or setting of stacks, used in connection with harvesting.
Vehicles specially adapted for carrying harvested crops with means for self-loading or unloading.
Combined or convertible apparatus

This subclass covers mowers combined with apparatus performing additional operations (e.g. threshing) while mowing, mowers convertible to apparatus for purposes other than mowing (e.g. for sweeping snow), and mowers capable of performing operations other than mowing (e.g. soil-working). The non-mowing parts of such mowers are only covered by this subclass if they are immediately associated with the mowing parts or the mowing process. Otherwise they are covered by the places for the non-mowing operations.

This subclass covers digging harvesters (e.g. for root crops) combined with apparatus performing additional operations (e.g. topping, separating or planting) while harvesting. The non-harvesting parts of such combinations are only covered by this subclass if they are immediately associated with the harvesting parts or the harvesting process. Otherwise they are covered by the places for the non-harvesting operations.
Hand tools for soil working

This subclass covers hand tools for soil working when specially adapted for harvesting, for example of root crops. This subclass also covers rakes and forks. A01B1/00 covers hand tools for soil working in general, e.g. spades, shovels or hoes, with the exception of rakes and forks.
Binding

This subclass covers apparatus specially adapted for binding of harvested hay, straw or similar crops, with the exception of stationary apparatus or hand tools, which are covered by A01F1/00, and binding apparatus specially adapted for baling presses, which is covered by A01F15/14. Binding in general is covered by B65B, for example B65B13/00 and B65B27/12.
Shredding or pulverising

This subclass covers the shredding or pulverising of stubble or other vegetation in situ, e.g. for the purpose of producing mulch, but does not cover other mechanical destruction of unwanted vegetation, which is covered by group A01M21/02.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Soil working tools or machines for weeding or thinning
Cutting implements specially adapted for horticultural purposes, e.g. flower shears, fruit shears, secateurs or hedge shears
Machines for cutting sods or turf from lawns or meadows
Apparatus for destruction of unwanted vegetation

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines that pick up mown material from the ground and bale it
Machines that pick up mown material from the ground and cut it, e.g. field choppers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gatherers for removing stones, undesirable roots or the like from the soil
Parts, details or accessories of agricultural machines in general
Baling of hay, straw or the like
Stacks for storing of harvested products
Cutting machines specially adapted for hay, straw or the like
"Harvesting" of oysters, mussels, sponges or the like
Treatment of harvested fruit or vegetables, not otherwise provided for, e.g. extracting juice, cleaning of vegetables or topping of onions
Mechanical metal working without essentially removing material,e.g. making harvesting tools
Grinding; Polishing,e.g. sharpening of cutting edges
Handles for hand implements in general
Vehicles specially adapted for load transportation, or for transporting, carrying or comprising special loads or objects, in general
Hoisting or lifting in general, e.g. hay hoists
Removing undesired matter from land, not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Harvester or mower combined with a threshing device.
Hand tool having two or more tines that are used for lifting, digging or pitching.
Perform one of the methods defined in the definition statement in order to make use of the separated, mown or gathered plant material.
Mown forage crop in a dry or partially dry state.
Working on mown forage crop lying on the ground with the intention to make hay.
Cut down grass, cereals or other standing plants.

Separate grains or seeds from harvested plants or plant parts (e.g. cereals, maize/corn, peas, beans or pine cones) by mechanical action (e.g. shaking, stamping, rubbing, beating or applying intermittent pressure).
Any of a kingdom (Plantae) of multicellular eukaryotic mostly photosynthetic organisms typically lacking locomotive movement or obvious nervous or sensory organs and possessing cellulose cell walls.

definition-item.definition-title: Hand-cutting implements for harvesting (hedge trimming means A01G3/04; {hand-cutting in general B26; making from sheet metal B21D53/72; making by rolling B21H7/10})

definition-item.definition-title: Diggers, e.g. potato ploughs

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
the plough or blade itself which penetrates into the ground for loosening the root crops.
Example of a potato plough (from US2519761 by John R. Hobbs)

definition-item.definition-title: Digging machines with sieve graters but without conveying mechanisms

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

definition-item.definition-title: Digging machines with sieving and conveying mechanisms

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The sieving mechanism acts as conveying mechanism as well.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

table-column.paragraph-text: Endless belts in binders or combines

section-body.paragraph-text: Special aspects of the documents classified in this group are further classified using an Indexing Code of A01D2017/103 (construction), A01D2017/105 (driving means), A01D2017/106 (fingers on belt), and A01D2017/108 (paddles on belt).

definition-item.definition-title: Digging machines with centrifugal wheels, drums or spinners

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Digging machines comprising centrifugal wheels, drums or spinners in order to clean and convey the root crop after having been lifted from the ground.
Example of centrifugal wheels from EP0418985 by Hack

definition-item.definition-title: Digging machines with potato-picking implements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Digging machines in which the root crop is picked up by a conveying element immediately after having been loosened by a very short plough.
Example from EP0719495 by Amac BV.

definition-item.definition-title: Topping machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Removing the top part of root crops (e.g. sugar beet).
Example from US2587258 by Wilkinson Read A.

definition-item.definition-title: cutting the tops before being lifted

section-body.paragraph-text: Special aspects of the documents classified in this group are further classified using an Indexing Code of A01D2023/022 (rotatable non cutting devices), A01D2023/024 (fix blades), A01D2023/026 (movable knives), and A01D2023/028 (cutters on a shaft)

definition-item.definition-title: cutting the tops after being lifted

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Removing the top part of root crops after the root crop has been lifted (i.e. extracted from the soil).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processing of harvested produce in bulk

definition-item.definition-title: Lifters for beet or like crops

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices which lift the root crop from ground level upwards.
Example from US1331957 by Utah Idaho Sugar Co.

definition-item.definition-title: Machines with both topping and lifting mechanisms

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines comprising means for both lifting the root crop from ground level upwards and removing the top part of said crop (simultaneously or not).

definition-item.definition-title: Other digging harvesters {(for harvesting asparagus A01D45/007)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Accessories for digging harvesters

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Accessories for digging harvesters, i.e. devices which do not form part of the digging and topping arrangements covered by the previous groups (A01D13/00 - A01D31/00), but which also form part of a root crop harvester (e.g. special cleaning devices, drives, etc). See subgroups for some particular accessories which should be classified in one of those and not in this head group.
Special aspects of the documents classified in this group and subgroups, which relate to yield crop determination are further classified using an Indexing Code of A01D2033/005.

definition-item.definition-title: Special sorting and cleaning mechanisms

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangements to facilitate transportation specially adapted therefor (A01D78/1021 takes precedence; for other agricultural machines or implements A01B73/00; carriers A01D80/005)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: For other agricultural machines or implements

definition-item.definition-title: {Pivotable rotor support arms (A01D78/1007 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements to facilitate transportation specially adapted therefor

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangements of tines (A01D78/1007 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements to facilitate transportation specially adapted therefor

definition-item.definition-title: {Carriers for the transport of haymakers (arrangements of the haymaker to facilitate transportation A01D78/1007)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements of the haymaker to facilitate transportation

definition-item.definition-title: Crop conditioners, i.e. machines for crushing or bruising stalks (combined with harvesters A01D43/10)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Haymakers not provided for in a single one of groups A01D76/00 - A01D82/00

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Haymakers with tines that are stationary with respect to the machine during operation but that may be liftable for dumping
Crop conditioners, i. e. machines for crushing or bruising stalks

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for making or setting stacks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Creating a stack of loose products or of bales.
Example from FR1366404 by Berghoff Werner.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {making or setting stacks of cereals or grass, e.g. rack formers, fixed haystacks (rakes for making windrows, haysweeps A01D76/006; drying racks A01F25/12)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subdivision of the previous group which covers devices where loose product is actively accumulated in order to create a stack.
Example from US3402829 by Leedahl Alvin N.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {with binding equipment, e.g. binding groups of bales}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Arrangements for making or setting stacks comprising binding equipment for tying the whole stack.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for forming groups of bales without binding them

definition-item.definition-title: {Forming groups of bales, e.g. bale sledges (loaders for bales A01D87/12; vehicles for loading bales A01D90/08)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Binding means for a group of bales

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

Special aspects of the documents classified in this group Are further classified using Indexing Codes of A01D2085/007 (devices directly attached to a baler) and A01D2085/008 (groups of bales just at horizontal level)

definition-item.definition-title: Loaders for hay or like field crops (combined with mowers A01D43/06)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices for displacing on the fields hay or like field crops in loose form or as bales
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {with chopping devices (harvesters with loaders A01D43/06; forage harvesters A01D43/08; special adaptations of cutting machines for hay, straw or fodder A01F29/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special adaptations of cutting machines for hay, straw or fodder

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangements for making a strand (forming round bales A01F15/07)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Loaders comprising means for producing a strand of product, e.g. by means of rollers.
Example from GB1150050 by Claas.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Coupling arrangements between tractors, loaders or vehicles (for harvesters A01D67/005)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {with gripping or clamping devices (manure loaders A01C3/04)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Tractor-mounted loaders (buck-rakes, transporting rakes A01D87/08; manure loaders A01C3/04; fork loaders, fork lifts B66F; earth-moving machines E02F)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with sweep rakes {, i.e. buck-rakes, e.g. transporting rakes}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with blowers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Loading or distributing arrangements in forage silos

definition-item.definition-title: {for sheaves, stacks}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {for bales on the ground (vehicles for loading A01D90/08)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Loaders directly connected to a 3-point hitch of a tractor which lack their own means of displacement which would allow handling of bales in a broader range of movements.
Example from EP0638229 by Lowe Maurice Samuel.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Loaders directly connected to a 3-point hitch of a tractor comprising their own means of displacement, which allow handling of bales in a broader range of movements.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Forks for loads with side clamps

section-body.paragraph-text: If the documents classified in this group comprise a manual trolley, then they must be also indexed in the group A01D2087/123

definition-item.definition-title: {mounted on the press without laying down the bales}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Example from WO2009141692 by CAEB Internat. SRL

definition-item.definition-title: {Loaders for stacks or groups of bales}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Example from US3052366 by Duncan Wilber O.

definition-item.definition-title: {Apparatus for handling, loading or unrolling round bales}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Apparatus requiring a certain degree of flexibility in displacing the bale in vertical and horizontal direction without depending on the movement of the vehicle alone, and/or the capacity of unrolling the round bale.
Example 1 from FR2628088 by Mailleux.
Example 2 from WO9911113 by Adolfsson Lars Gunnar.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Loaders connected to a 3-point hitch of a tractor with no displacing means of their own and without any unrolling mechanism for the bale.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Forks for loads with side clamps

section-body.paragraph-text: If the documents classified in this group are capable of unrolling or breaking round bales, then they must be also indexed in the group A01D2087/128

definition-item.definition-title: Pick-ups for loaders, chaff-cutters, balers, field-threshers, or the like {, i.e. attachments for picking-up hay or the like field crops (field threshers with windrow pick-up apparatus A01D41/10)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Attachments for picking-up hay or the like field crops.
Example from EP1929854 by Class Salgau GmbH.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Headers for ears and similar crops

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Field threshers with windrow pick-up apparatus

definition-item.definition-title: {Mountings, e.g. height adjustment, wheels, lifting devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Mounting means for the pick-up in order to connect it to the machine where it is installed (e.g. harverster, loading wagon, etc).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Movable wheels for vehicles and tractors

definition-item.definition-title: {Accessories (feeding devices for baling presses A01F15/10; for cutting machines A01F29/10)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Accessories for the pick-up, i.e. devices which do not form part of the pick-up arrangements covered by the previous groups (A01D89/00 - A01D89/005), but which also form part of a pick-up device. See subgroups for some particular accessories which should be classified in one of those and not in this head group.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Vehicles for carrying harvested crops with means for selfloading or unloading (combined with mowers A01D43/06)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pick up 6 with feeler wheel 7 and cutting device 11 comprising the conveying rotor 12 and the knife assembly 13 in the cutting frame.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Load transporting vehicles modified to facilitate loading in general
Bucket cars, i.e. having scraper bowls

section-body.paragraph-text: If the documents classified in this group (and subgroups) are for transport of bunches of bananas, they must be also indexed in the group A01D2090/005

definition-item.definition-title: Loading means

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with chaff cutters, {i.e. choppers} used as loading and cutting means (A01D43/08 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mowers combined with means for cutting up the mown crop

definition-item.definition-title: with bale-forming means additionally used for loading; with means for picking-up bales and transporting them into the vehicle

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Example from US5813814 by Justice Enterprises Inc.
If the documents classified in this group pick up loose product instead of bales, then they must be also indexed in the group A01D2090/086

definition-item.definition-title: {Round-bale trailers (trailers in general B62D)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Unloading means

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with additional devices or implements (arrangements of coupling devices A01B59/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Additional devices or implements for the vehicles for carrying harvested crops with means for self-loading or unloading, i.e. devices which do not form part of the aspects covered by the previous groups (A01D90/00 - A01D90/105, A01D90/14 and A01D90/16), but which also form part of such vehicles (e.g. a drying mechanism for treating the product loaded onto the vehicle).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Methods for harvesting agricultural products

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Methods for harvesting, but not particular machines or devices. Said methods must be characterised by a number of steps or procedures to be followed during harvesting (e.g. a method for harvesting sugar cane consisting of cutting the plant at 20%, 50% and 70% of its height, letting the different pieces dry on the ground for two days on different windrows, and collecting them separately).

definition-item.definition-title: Products growing above the soil (fruit, hops A01D46/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
